comm: Taylor begins with a fuller length slanting on the pads which is turned away to the leg side
another full delivery which this time is directed away through some vacant space to get Sri Lanka off the mark
short of a length outside off which is cut away to the fielder at point

length delivery on the pads which is negotiated away to the leg side easily enough, before the trigger-happy fieldsman at mid-on decided to have a shy at the non-striker's, earning Sri Lanka a couple more in overthrows
defended on the front foot towards the off side
going for the blockhole as this is clipped away on the full towards the leg side
Dishan into business straight away as he slams this loosener outside of off stump over the covers for a boundary
tries to force it away again through the covers, but doesn't quite get a hold of this
full delivery on middle and leg which is clipped away through the mid-on region
fails to get away this slightly shortish length on middle and leg
struck on the pads as he tried to fend this away to the leg side, with the ball popping over to the off side after the ricochet
leaves this back of a length going across to the keeper to end the over
back of a length outside off which is respected by Dilshan
glances away this shortish length off the pads to get Lahiru on strike
overpitched and angling in on leg as this is struck away to the bowler in his follow through
nicely forward to this fuller length which is defended away to the off side
does not middle this attempted scythe over the covers, with this slicing over towards extra-cover on the ring, but thankfully away from any fielders
solid in defence as he meets this length delivery on and around off stump
short and on the body as Dilshan swivels and pulls it to fine leg
elects to let this one through to the keeper
opens the face to this slightly back of a length, but it is fielded by the man at point, who runs to his right before making the save
short ball which was intended to get the batsman to hook to the squarish third man fielder but Lahiru is unable to get it away fluently
angled into the pads as Dilshan can't connect with the flick, but is able to run the leg bye in the end
gets behind this shortish length angling away to the off side quite comfortably
squirts away this shortish length outside of off towards sweeper cover
overpitched and driven in the air towards the long on fielder, with this one landing just before
solid as a rock as he defends away this almost half-volley length on and around off
defended off the back foot by the batsman
nicely behind this length delivery on and around off stump
looks to dab this shortish length flying through outside off, but is late as this one gets good carry as it reached the keeper's gloves
too short outside off which just sits up for Dilly, who is able to rock back and pull this authoritatively through square-leg for four
tries to get it away again through the same region, except mistimes the stroke to find long leg

and Lahiru has to go after his 20-ball struggle as he chases after this length delivery slanting away from him, giving him enough room to entice the cover drive, but he offers up an edge which flies comfortably to the second slip
and he gets off the mark with an easy push through long off which beats the dive from the mid-off fielder, but is pulled back before the boundary
is late on this short of a length outside of off which flies through to the keeper
straying on the pads as Dilshan tucks him away through deep backward square
bowls a good length delivery which is defended away towards mid-on
defends this length delivery back towards the bowler
Taylor probes away around the off-stump as Sangakkara presses forward, knocking this one away toward mid-off
respects the bowler as he delivers another short of a length outside off
another dot which Sangakkara is content to defend away
breaks the potential maiden with a nudge away through mid-on to get to the other end
fuller length, and some width, as Sangakkara eases into that familiar cover-drive that races away to the extra-cover boundary
tries to pierce the gap through cover point, but is held by the close-in fielder
gets forward slightly before bunting this one away softly on the off side
pitched up on middle and off as this is steered to the right of the bowler to pickup a single through long off
drives on the up through long off, but there is some protection for the stroke
slightly back of a length which is struck away to the fielder at point
gets nicely forward to defend this fullish length shaping in from off
Sangakkara comes forward and push-drives it to mid-off, with the ball hitting the higher part of the bat
turns away this length delivery through the leg side, but picks the close-in fielder
not very fluent from Sangakkara as he sliced uppishly over the covers to target the square boundary, before a good slide before the boundary kept him to just the three runs
back of a length just outside of off which Dilshan fails to get away off the back foot as he targeted the cover region
opts for the tap-and-run through mid-off to retain the strike
able to pickup a couple through midwicket with ease
defended away on the front foot towards the covers
times this punch beautifully through long on to pickup four runs. Tried not to over-hit it as this got over the rope
struck away towards the long off region as he fails to pick the gap
thrashes away this fuller length outside of off through extra-cover now to pickup four more
looks to pickup more runs through the covers now as he got away the shot, but can't find the space
defends away this back of a length to the bowler, who is able to get to it in his follow through
half-volley outside of off which is carted away by Sangakkara through long on to pickup a boundary. In this kind of form, he can do what he wishes
now targets deep square-leg with a gentle clip that is reined in before the boundary
turns away a single through deep midwicket to get Dilshan on strike
bunts away this short of a length going across him towards the off side
looking for the slightly wide yorker as he delivers this low, full toss which is struck instinctively to the fielder at mid-off, who is able to get to it in the end
fullish length which is defended back to the bowler
hits through the line to this fuller length outside off to find the boundary at deep extra-cover. Trademark Dilshan bludgeon really
eases away this back of a length now in the same channel, but straight to point
slipping down the pads as this is flicked away towards deep midwicket
slow, length delivery which Sangakkara reads well enough to glance away through fine leg
fires one well down the leg side which Dilshan tries in vain to flick away uppishly through backward square
full delivery on middle and leg which is clipped straight to the short mid-on in place
starts from round the wicket as this full delivery is tucked away on the leg side
negotiates this slightly fullish length delivery angling across him
similar delivery as before, with this one placed down to the deep midwicket
short and outside off, Dilshan cracks the cut towards backward point, MacLeod dives to his left and parries it to third man. He saved a certain boundary there
full and on off. Looked like an off-cutter as Sangakkara drives it back to the bowler
back of a length and close to off stump. Sangakkara taps it in front of backward point, but when he realises how close the fielder was, decides to abort the single
glanced away off the pads to the man at deep square-leg
slow delivery down the leg side which is allowed to carry through to the keeper, who takes it with a tumble before feigning an appeal to try and put off the umpire
steered away a bit uppishly through third man to get to the other end
presses forward to this length delivery outside his off stump
change of pace from Davey as Dilshan watches it carefully before knocking it away through backward point
steered away through the off side to pinch a run
picks up a single now through midwicket to keep the strike
eases away a run square off the wicket on the leg side
overpitced slightly outside off as Sangakkara drives this away crisply through extra-cover to bring up the fifty-run partnership
tries to pinch a single with a dab down to long on, but hits it a bit too straight to the fielder
struck on the pads as he was late on this leg-side slanting delivery. Hopeful appeal from Scotland, but that is actually what it was, hopeful
fires down the line once more as Dilshan this time makes a connection to get to the other end
lets loose a full toss which is played away by Sangakkara towards extra-cover, in hopes of beating the fielder on the ring, but he puts in a fine stop to cut short the dream
caresses away this flighted delivery towards point, with some sloppy fielding by backward point allowing for the run to be taken. Moves Sangakkara to 400 runs for the tournament
flighted on middle as Dilshan tucks it away to short midwicket
looks to cut away this one flighted across, but is late as the ball rushes past the edge
tries to force away a stroke past the bowler, but no can do
gets inside the line and glances it to the left of the leg slip fielder for a couple
able to tuck away a single now behind of square to keep the strike
Dilshan has the cap on now as he strikes away this length delivery towards long off
tries to get this one now past the bowler to his right, but the close-in fielders around mid-on were all over it
looks for the drive through the covers, but is held inside of the ring
looks to glide it past the point fielder outside of off, but is thwarted in his attempt
forced away now through cover, but Machan puts in a fine dive at the position
eases a single down to long on to retain the strike
opts for the cut again to this one pushed through across him, as he is able to just enough to get through for the run, despite the initial stop by the fielder at backward point
steered away through midwicket as he continues to help build a healthy foundation for the team
turns away this flatter one through deep midwicket for one
slight interest from the close-in fielders as he pushed at this one floated in outside off, with this going in the air temporarily as it went through to the bowler
short and outside off as Sangakkara cuts to sweeper cover
succeeds in finding the outside edge, but with no slip in place, this ends up running away to the third man boundary, despite the chase
full and on the stumps, Sangakkara punches it to mid-on and takes off immediately. Got the run easily even as the throw comes to his end
cuts this one away fiercely square off the wicket to bring up a deserved World Cup fifty. Has played a lovely hand so far
almost drags on this length outside off, as he went a few steps down before realising that the ball had gone nowhere. Is able to make it back to his crease before the keeper could stump him in time
tucks away the bowler through deep midwicket to earn a run
struck away back to the bowler, who rolls in his follow through as he went to field after it
steers a single down to deep extra-cover as they continue to rotate the strike well
whipped away off the pads now  towards deep square-leg
hangs on the back foot before working this one down to sweeper cover
gets low for the sweep as the keeper, in anticipation, shuffles over to the leg side before reaching out with this left hand to try and catch this paddle down the leg side
milks a single now through the off side
able to nudge this one away on the leg side as they scamper through for a tight single
short outside of off as this is clattered away to the man at sweeper cover
sweeps away this fullish length on the pads through fine leg to get four
now jabs away towards the off side, but is stopped by the close-in fielder
punched away of the back foot towards deep cover as he looks unbelievably comfortable out there. Hobart does have special memories for him (read 192 v Australia, 2007)
carves away a single to the man at the deep on the square boundary
works away this length delivery going across to end the over
short of a length which shapes in as Dilshan covers the line beautifully
dabs this shortish length outside of off to the squarish third man fielder
looks to push at this fuller one going across through the long off region, but mid-off has other ideas
waits on the back foot to get this length delivery away through midwicket
looks to drive on the up through long off, but to no avail
attacks this shortish length which angles in. Was cramped for space as he let loose the cut
first belligerent stroke from Sangakkara as he dances down to lift Davey cleanly over long off for four
now sensibly gets away a run through extra-cover as he ticks over to 45
too straight from the bowler, as Dilshan sends this one right back, with this hitting the non-striker's stumps
negotiates away this length delivery off the pads through deep midwicket
plays the shot down the ground when he sees long off sitting back
turns this length delivery off the pads towards deep backward square as he completes a brace in time of the throw
full delivery which is worked away to the fielder at mid-off
able to add one more to his tally as he punches away square off the wicket
fends away this length delivery on middle and leg
once again looks for room outside off for the late cut, which he manages to get away, despite the angle suggesting he would be cramped for room. Picked up by the third man fielder
goes round the wicket to the left-hander as this one is defended away to the leg side
looks to hit through the line as this length delivery angling in is sent down towards the long on region

full delivery, slanting down the leg side, as Dilshan fails to get away the paddle flick through fine leg, with the keeper, who was already up to the wicket, doing well to intercept this to his left. Batsman able to run an extra
bunts away this length delivery going across to the off side
caresses away through the covers as he inches ever close to yet another inevitable half-century
Dilshan too good as he got down again before fetching this length delivery outside off, paddling this over towards long leg now to get four more. Brave shot that got its due reward
this is excellent batting, good length ball just outside off, Dilshan shuffles across, bends his front knee and sweeps it behind square, the ball was timed superbly as it races across to the fence
Dilshan manages to clear the fence as Davey proves too predictable, keeping this on a length as Dilshan once more goes on his knee and hoicks it this time over deep backward square
slips in a yorker which Dilshan is able to dig out, much to Scotland's dismay
picks up a single with a jab down through long off
short and down leg as Dilshan pulls it to short fine leg, with the fielder diving to his right and saving a certain boundary

and Sangakkara eases to his fourth consecutive fifty-plus ODI score as he finds his treasured deep extra-cover region with a nice drive on the up. Has just cruised to the landmark as he looks forward towards potentially three figures
able to get away a run through midwicket now
Sangakkara just too good for Scotland as he uses his feet well to get down and slam this one inside-out over cover to find the boundary
floated up on off as Sangakkara turns it gently to short midwicket
and Dilshan pierces the gap at backward point with a hard slap that beats the boundary rider from third man quite comfortably
now sends this length delivery through extra-cover with a forceful bludgeon, but he did not time it quite as well as he would have liked

Sangakkars shifts into fourth gear as he waltzes down before lifting the bowler elegantly over cow corner to just get this over the rope. Ominous signs for Scotland as SL look to pulverise the record books in this outing
struck back to the bowler as he delivered this one in from round the wicket
dabs away a brace behind of square on the off side to keep the strike
overpitched and creamed down to long on, with Sangakkara hustling hard in order to make it two, with Dilshan obliging as he turned on the jets
guides this one away on the off side to the close-in fielder, but can't pinch a run
this time worked fine down the leg side, with the fielder at fine leg doing well to just save this from getting to the rope as he put in the dive
helps himself to a run through the long off region
goes for the conventional sweep through square-leg as he moves to 88
another calculated risk which comes off to a tee as he shimmies down to lift the bowler through extra-cover, with this just landing over the rope. Timed it beautifully in the end
defended away to the bowler to his right
Dilshan comes down the track and drives to mid-off's right, with a good stop that keeping it to a single. Machan bowled that from round the wicket
turned away carefully to the leg side by Sangakkara, as he opts to take a less-risk approach to his partner
now gets off the strike with a clip through the mid-on region
cut away square off the wicket, but is held by the fielder at point
works away a run now through the midwicket area to get this stand up to a 150-runs
advances down to try and manipulate this one flighed in through midwicket, but is slightly early into it as the ball pops over to the off side after getting a slight leading edge off the bat
cut away off the back foot towards extra-cover
tries to pinch a single on the leg side, but is unable to find the gap
on the front foot as this one drifted in is defended to the off side
uses the feet well to loft again over his favoured extra-cover region to get four more. Too good from Sangakkara. Scotland will be wondering what to do to break this partnership?
now eased away with a flick to the leg side as he gets to the other end
carved away off the back foot towards the fielder at deep extra-cover to end the over
able to help himself to a run through midwicket
targets deep extra-cover as he chips this one over the cover fielder, but hits it a bit squarer than he would have liked as this is picked up before the boundary
Dilshan able to get to 94 as he eases one through midwicket
picks his spot at cow corner before clubbing this one darted in outside off, slamming this away cleanly for half-a-dozen
tries to lure Sangakkara into the same stroke once more, except this time he just defends it away towards mid-off
slipping down the leg side now as the keeper does well to collect this down the right side

Sangakkara may have just got away with this as he clubs away the bowler uppishly through midwicket, who offered a full toss, with the fielder at extra-cover getting his left hand to it, but this was hit at such a rate of knots that it was destined for the boundary. Scotland would have loved for that to stick though. Hard to call it a dropped chance, but it was catchable as it was within his reach
almost drags this length delivery just outside off as he looked for the cut. Ends up running away through the fine leg region
mistimes this attempted strike through the covers as the ball lands away around mid-on
back of a length outside off which is punched to sweeper cover
creams this overpitched delivery, but is held by a fine stop by the mid-off fielder
jabs away the bowler towards the fielder at point, who is able to get behind it comfortably
sends this fuller one going across with a heave over the covers that is able to reach the extra-cover boundary without too much fuss
tries to cut away this short of a length on and around off, but the shot was never really on for the delivery
takes Sri Lanka to 200 with a push through the covers
looks to cream this overpitched delivery on middle and leg through mid-on, but the fielder does well to pounce on top of this
now looks to force one away through cover point, but is unable to do so
guides one down to long off for a comfortable run
meets this length delivery with the straightest of bats
slower delivery, down the leg side, and Sangakkara is able to manipulate this with a pull through long leg to get Sangakkara within a boundary now. Bad ball which was given the appropriate punishment
now blitzes a drive on the up through to deep cover as both batsmen sit pretty now on 98
Dilshan slaps hard at this length delivery outside of off, but can do no more than get a single as this lands up at deep cover

and Sangakkara is able to get to 99, albeit not in the most convincing of fashions, as he drives this fuller one straight to the extra-cover fielder, who fields it and sees Dilshan just short as he fires in a throw at the non-striker's. The ball connects, and allows Sangakkara to come through to 99
Dilshan moves to his fourth World Cup century with a clip down fine leg as he looks to the heavens to celebrate what has been a fine hand from the Sri Lankan opener

now it is Sangakkara's turn, as he rewrites history to bring up a fourth World Cup century on the trot, a feat unprecedented in the annals of ODI history, as he dabs away the bowler through third man with consummate ease. Becomes the first player to achieve four tons in a single edition as well. Was it ever really in doubt though?
must have been struck with fear as he slides this one well down the leg side
Dilshan able to find a boundary with a slice through backward point to this fuller delivery outside of off

shimmies over to the leg side just before the ball was delivered, before mistiming this loft to find the man at mid-off, who is able to get under it quite comfortably. Ends an excellent opening performance from Dilshan, who has set up his team quite beautifully here in Hobart for the final assault
gets away with this mistimed chip over the covers, as this just gets over the ring
now works away this length outside of his off stump to the close-in fielder inside of the ring
Mahela looked to get into position to ramp this over the keeper, but is late on the short ball
nicely behind the line of this back of a length on and around off to end the over
backs away, almost as if he read the bowler's mind as he let go off the short ball, which is then dispatched with a ramp over the backward point region to get maximum
backs away again as he creams this length delivery over cover point to find the boundary once more
now shows some innovation as he positions for the scoop over fine leg, which he is able to get away sufficiently to beat short fine leg to the boundary. Sangakkara toying with Scotland at the moment
once again backs away as Evans is proving far too predictable here. Able to get his hands through the ball to slice this over third man for four more
goes for the slower delivery down the leg side, but gets it far too down
now shimmies over to the off side to paddle this over fine leg, beating the man at around long leg to find the rope. Showing off his 360-degree batting prowess here
fires in a yorker outside of off, which becomes a low, full toss, as Sangakkara gropes at this to try and paddle it once more over fine leg, but ends up getting it away more through midwicket
continues from round the wicket as he fires this well wide of the margin. Probably the only way not to go for runs off the bat
looks to scythe this away through the covers, but mistimes the stroke back to the bowler
slides one in on middle and leg which Sangakkara fails to flick away behind of square, but it doesn't stop him from running the leg bye
tries to cut this short of a length past the man at point, but to no avail

Mahela, looking to slam down the ground, ends up getting a bottom-edge which goes high up over mid-off, who is able to settle under it quite comfortably. Bowled the off cutter there to unearth a big wicket for Scotland. Mahela can go back to his nap now as he departs with just 2 to his name

Sangakkara must have missed his buddy out there as he goes after this length delivery going across, with the left-hander out of his crease as he tried to slice this over point, but ends up feeding an edge to the keeper, who goes up for it instantaneously. Sangakkara exits the field after making both ODI and World Cup history. Surely he can't make it five now? Guess we will have to wait and see
Kusal, making his World Cup debut, is able to get his tally off with a glance behind of square to this delivery on the pads
flights one in from round the wicket which is defended by the batsman
cuts away the bowler now square off the wicket for one
defended by the batsman off the back foot
got through his sighter the previous delivery before sending this one sliding on the pads with a slog-sweep through long leg that went powerfully over the rope
now targets the squarish third man region with a solid reverse-sweep that just races through to the boundary
Mathews on a tear as he slams this next, leg-side delivery, over the vacant cow corner to end the over in style

Kusal shows his inner Jayasuriya with a slice over extra-cover which is able to get to the boundary in the end. Sri Lanka will need more of that if they threaten to take down the overall record for highest first-innings total at a World Cup
now pulls this shorter one through long leg to get to the other end
comes down the track before heaving this over to the fielder at long on
full again, outside of off, as this one is steered straight to mid-on
takes on the throwing arm of Machan at extra-cover as he drives away this length delivery, haring to the other end to beat the throw
looks to cart away this shorter delivery through backward square with a swivel, but is late on the ball
fullish length which is pushed away softly to the off side before they scampered through for the single
whipped away off the pads behind of square as they rotate the strike
fuller length on middle and leg which is flicked away uppishly over the deep midwicket area
connected sweetly with this shortish length on middle and leg which is sent high over long leg for maximum. Shades of Sanath in that finish
targets the gap at deep extra-cover with a chip to this low, full toss, which has enough on it to beat the converging fielders from long off and deep cover respectively
Evans thrown of his lines here as he slips in a wide down the leg side
is early on this length delivery going across, with the left-hander inside-edging onto the pads
fuller length, going across the batsman, which is struck away to the mid-off fielder
pitched up now on middle and leg as Kusal uses his wrists well to flick this away high over backward square, with the ball coming down eventually to just get over the boundary
sends in a yorker on and around off which is dug away to the bowler in his follow through, who went up for the catch as he stretched out the right hand

Kusal, looking to pepper the long on boundary now, gets a bottom-edge which goes high up over the region, with the man at cow corner running across before putting in a dive at the last moment to pluck this from the air. Wonderful catch in the end removes the dangerous Kusal, who looked to be in fine form
almost-yorker length, going across him, as he digs this out to get this over the long off region on the bounce
guides this length delivery outside of off down through long off to end the over
begins from round the wicket as this one is respected by Thisara, for now
now looks for the quick single down the leg side to get Mathews on strike

dropped looking to send Machan high over deep midwicket as he cleared the front leg, but didn't quite get a hold of this as it falls inside of the rope, but the fielder in the deep ends up grassing the chance
Mathews able to pickup a single to get to the other end
tries to slap away square off the wicket, but the fielder at point is equal to it
defended by Perera to end the over
delivers a yorker which is clipped away by Mathews to deep midwicket
targets the same area as his captain as he too picks up a run
almost a mirror version of what happened the previous ball, as midwicket is brought into play once more
tries to get under this full delivery on middle and leg, but only succeeds at finding long on
strong clips of the pads which finds its way to deep midwicket
Perera looking to smash down the ground as he sliced this over to long off, who sat back a bit too much as he could have come forward to claim the catch
steers away a single through midwicket to get to the other end
bowled from round the wicket as he sends this bludgeon high over the deep midwicket boundary. Scotland don't know where to get any respite at the moment
gets this one wrong as he offers a gentle full toss from round the wicket which is clubbed away easily over the same region to make it consecutive sixes
goes over the wicket now, but it really doesn't make a difference as Mathews goes on to just hammer this over the cow corner boundary this time
and Mathews earns the second-fastest World Cup fifty this tournament with another slam over midwicket which has enough on it to reach over the rope

and Mathews, looking to make it 31 runs for the over with yet another six over midwicket, this time holes out as the bowler lobs up another hit-me ball which falls to the fielder inside of the boundary, who takes it well enough not to back-peddle onto the rope
digs in a fuller length which is guided away through the long on region
is late on this fuller one outside of off as he looked for the drive
Prasanna able to get off the mark with a steer through the covers
Sri Lanka falling away slightly here as Thisara, looking for the massive heave over midwicket, ends up finding the fielder on the boundary, who is able to take the catch
able to get away a single through cover point
yorker length outside off which Kulasekara digs out as the inside-edge rolls back onto the pads
length delivery whipped away off the pads behind of square
short of a length which is defended to the bowler off the back foot
shortish length, angling down the pads, as this is helped away through fine leg with a flick

completely mistimes this short ball as he sends this over to deep midwicket, who lunges forward to take the catch cleanly. Sri Lanka now eight down as Scotland threaten to bundle them out before the quota of fifty overs
delivers a wide well down the leg side
is far too early into the cut for this short of a length which goes through outside of off
able to get away a single through extra-cover to retain the strike
able to reach out and drill this full length outside off to the fielder at sweeper cover
fails to get away this shot through the off side, with this one ending up near mid-on
this time gets away the slap to mid-off as he turns on the jets to get through for the tight single
dropped hits this low full toss firmly back to the bowler in his follow through, who is unable to grasp it as it came back to him at an awkward height

full, outside of off, as Malinga slices this one over cover, with the fielder able to get under it nicely. Scotland just one away from ending Sri Lanka's innings prematurely, which probably wasn't on the cards even ten overs back...
steers away this fuller length outside of off towards deep extra-cover to keep the strike from the debutant
full and straddling on the pads as this is tucked away through fine leg
bowls a slow bouncer outside off which Dushmanta is unable to connect with, despite the half-hearted attempt
works away the bowler off his back foot through mid-on, with the batsmen initially looking to take the run, before Kula ended up sending him back
Chameera opens up his World Cup runs tally with an unconvincing slice over the covers, as he is able to come back in time for the second
simply lifts this fuller one going down the leg side over long on, but didn't time it well enough for this to get to the boundary
uses his wrists to work this fuller one outside off to the man at mid-on

heaves away this length delivery outside off through long off, with Berrington taking a tumble in his follow through. Looks like he slipped as he delivered the ball, with the bowler clutching his left knee
delivers a low, full toss which is angled away through backward square

gets on one knee as he looked to hammer this length delivery over the covers, but is late on it. The keeper puts in some good work to remove the bails when he thinks he sees Kula overbalancing, but the batsman's foot was behind the line the entire time
backs away a touch before opening the face slightly to loft over extra-cover for a boundary
overpitched and lifted with ease by Kula over long on as he held the pose after for the photographers. This one just sails over as he timed it quite superbly in the end
Kula able to retain the strike with a clip through to deep midwicket
yorker outside off which Kulasekara looks to dig it out, but the ball takes the inside-edge and rolls towards short midwicket
drives away this fuller length going across to the fielder at extra-cover
half-volley which is chipped down to the man at long off, as Dushmanta ran the first one well enough to come back in time for the second
looking for the yorker at the base of middle and off as Chameera is able to glide this away through third man for a boundary, with the fielder inside of the ring in the region
gets Kula on strike with a push through long on
fails to reach this fullish length going across as the keeper whips off the bails soon after in hopes he had overbalanced. Ends a strong effort from Sri Lanka with the bat
begins with a short of a length, with swings away outside of off, as this is fended away towards the off side by the batsman

and Malinga removes Kyle Coetzer with a short of a length which gets the leading edge as he pushed at it half-heartedly, with Malinga claiming this dolly offered up to him in his follow through. Sri Lanka off to the perfect start, and Scotland one down with none on the board
fuller length on middle and off which Machan gets nicely behind the line of
short ball which has Machan weaving out of its path, as Malinga seems to have slipped in a quicker one here
gets away with this hook over towards long leg, with this one falling safely in the end before the fielder could get to in the deep
looking for the attempted slower ball as he ends up dishing a full toss across the batsman which is struck away through third man
length delivery which gets a bit of away movement as it went across Machan
fullish length on middle and leg which is bunted away towards the leg side
length delivery angling through to the slips as Machan cannot be enticed to have a go
nicely behind the line as he pushes at this slightly back of a length delivery through the long on region, beating the dive from the mid-on fielder
content to just shoulder arms to this length delivery going across
looks to force this one away through cover point, but the man at the position is able to get to it in flash
shortish length which is worked away by the batsman behind of square
Malinga attempts the slower yorker, which turns out to be a low full toss and on MacLeod's pads that is clipped away behind square on the on-side for a couple
pushes at this back of a length to get it down towards deep cover, but is pulled back before the rope
attacks again through the point region as the chasing fielders do well to get to it
full and on the stumps as this is eased away through the mid-on region
searches for the blockhole as this one on and around off is dug away to him in his follow through
full delivery angling on the pads as this is worked away to the silly mid-on
strikes him on the pads, but the batsman got an inside-edge, and the angle also suggested this was doing too much anyways
pushes at this length delivery outside of off, but some poor fielding by Prasanna at mid-off allows them through for the run
backs away as he looks to create room to force this back of a length going across him over the covers, but in the end gets away too far from the ball to make any kind of connection
reaches out again to this one slanting across, with third man called into action
length delivery which gets a slight outside edge as third man comes round to collect
fires in a short one which doesn't quite climb as much as it should have, as the batsman does well enough to get out of its way
shortish length which doesn't bounce as much as expected as MacLeod prodded forward to defend
delivers a sharp bouncer which flies over the batsman's head as the umpire signals to the scorers
covers the line of this back of a length on and around middle
pushes at this length delivery shaping away outside off as this flies through the vacant gully region towards third man
length just outside of off which is fended away by Machan to the off side
searching for the yorker as Machan waited on this before steering away through the covers for one
negotiates this length delivery going across him with ease
first, real aggressive stroke from Scotland as Machan sends this slightly back of a length screaming away square off the wicket with a powerful cut
length on middle and leg which is defended back towards the bowler
short of a length and going across as this is worked away off the back foot towards cover
swinging on the pads as this is glanced away through square-leg
length delivery going across which is pushed off the back foot through long off, but is reined in before the boundary
bouncer on middle and off which is avoided by the batsman in the end
has a go with an attempted pull to this shorter one which climbs over him. Signalled one for the over
pitches it up now, straying a bit on middle and leg, as this is bunted away through mid-on
length delivery, shaping away outside of off, as this is struck towards the fielder at mid-off
short ball which MacLeod tries to hook away, but this is far too short as Malinga is penalised by the leg umpire

another length delivery which is sent away, courtesy of an outside edge, through the gully region, and despite shoring it with a wide slip and backward point, still manages to thread the needle to end up at third man
goes round the wicket as he sends in a yorker which is dug out successfully by Machan
length delivery on middle and leg which is handled with aplomb by the batsman
forced away on the off side, but can't penetrate any space
darts in a yorker which has MacLeod playing all around it as he looked to dig away to the leg side. The shape coming in deceived Calum, who is sent back to the pavilion with 11 to his name
fuller length, delivered outside of off, as this is shouldered arms to
half-volley outside of off which is driven on the up through cover point, with this one pulled back just before the rope by Prasanna at the square boundary
punches away this length delivery going across to the fielder at mid-off
begins with a short of a length which climbs appreciably as it was collected by Sangakkara
slips in one on middle and leg which is negotiated safely by the captain
fullish length, outside of off, and the batsman can't be tempted to flirt with it
gets away a drive through the covers that beats the fielder on the ring to reach the deep extra-cover boundary. Just timed away beautifully by Preston
now looks to get past the backward point, but hits it straight to the fielder
flashes at this short of a length which Preston fails to connect. Was close to an outside edge there
worked away on the front foot towards the cover fielder, with the man getting on top of it soon after
comes down the track to try and heave Kula over mid-on, but ends up miscuing it to the fielder, who is able to stop it after it bounced on him
shortish length which the batsman fails to get a hold off as he looked to pull through midwicket
sliding well down the leg side as he looked for the movement inside to the batsman
almost drags on this length delivery snaking in a bit outside off
another inswinging delivery in the same channel which is mishit away towards mid-on
defends this attempted inswinging delivery outside his off stump
length delivery which is driven away on the up through extra-cover, but doesn't quite middle it in the end
some fortune for Machan as he gets away this inside-edge after going for the pull behind of square, with the ball just avoiding the off peg as it went behind
attempts to power this shorter length through midwicket, but is late on the delivery
pulled away through to deep midwicket as Preston is handed the strike
shortish length, slanting on the pads, as Preston utilises the angle to pull this fiercely through square-leg  for four
elects to shoulder arms to this length delivery flying through outside of off stump
begins from round the wicket as this one is fended away towards the leg side

Dilshan fires in a quicker one which looks to have Machan plumb in front as he played all around it. Given out by the umpire straight away, but Machan wants a review after discussing with his partner. No issues with the no-ball. Delivered the arm ball which looks to have struck the front pad, with nothing on Snicko to suggest there was an inside-edge. All about whether it is clipping the stumps, and the verdict is in, with 'umpire's call' being given for this hitting the wicket, so Machan has to go. Big blow to Scotland's chances as he was one of their more established batsmen
continues from round the wicket as this one is defended off the back foot
defended by Coleman with soft hands
blitzed away through to deep extra-cover to get off the strike
sweeps this one drifting across to find the fine leg region
negotiates this first one drifted in on and around off
able to force away a drive square off the wicket to the deep point fielder
jabbed away off the back foot now as Scotland raise their fifty with that single through extra-cover
nicely on the front foot to keep out this one drifting in to him
sees this fractionally short before getting into position to short-arm pull this over the short backward square fielder to the boundary
prods forward before turning this one away behind of square to keep the strike
gets forward to this one sliding in from round the wicket
tries to force away a drive through mid-off, but to no avail

snappy work from behind the stumps by Sangakkara as Preston is late on this push, with the keeper removing the bails when he sees the batsman dragging his foot. Replays confirm that Preston still had his foot grounded when the bails were removed.
played back to the bowler in his follow through
cut away off the back foot towards cover point
tossed up across the batsman as the eventual drive ends up finding mid-off in a hurry
driven away forcefully through to deep extra-cover as Coleman is handed the strike
risky shot as he gets away this paddle through fine leg
now picks up a single on the off side through sweeper cover
struck away towards the fielder at long off in the deep
drifting down the leg side as Coleman is able to tickle this away through fine leg
ends the over with a gentle clip through midwicket
continues from round the wicket as this one ends up back to him in his follow through
glances away the bowler now through the leg side as they scurry through for the run
driven firmly towards long off as he took off the run, which he ends up making safely in the end
rocks forward before nudging this one away through mid-on
advances down the track before playing this back to the bowler
picks a single now through square-leg as the drizzle has started to come down
fails to get away the cut through the off side
now comes down to help himself to a single through long off
onto the front foot to defend this one away softly on the off side
steered down towards long off as he used his feet well to get to the pitch
defended with a nice, high elbow as the ball ends up near cover point
darted in on middle and leg as this is flicked away through midwicket
this one kept low as Preston defended this one away through the leg side
negotiates this one off the back foot
picks up a single as he plays the good ole tap-and-run outside his off stump to perfection
looks for the reverse sweep but is late on the ball, with Sanga collecting it
rocks forward to keep out this Dilshan special on middle stump
advances down to work this one away down to long on to end the over
eases away a run through long off
drives this one away firmly to the man at deep extra-cover
able to tuck this one away just behind of square on the leg side
darted in outside off as Preston comes down the track before heaving this over the space at cow corner for a boundary
sliding on middle and leg as this goes off the front pad, with Sangakkara coming round to catch this, but there was no contact with bat or glove
slaps away a single down to deep extra-cover
short and well outside off as this dabbed straight to the fielder at short third man
content to just negotiate this one away softly on the leg side
able to get a single with a push down to long off
comes down the track before lofting Dilshan gracefully over deep extra-cover to get this over the rope after a couple of bounces
defended back to the bowler in his follow through
gets forward to play at this one with soft hands before setting off for the other end to complete the run
shortish length, outside of off, which is run down through the third man region
short of a length and fended away by the batsman on the leg side
punched away off the back foot to locate the man at deep extra-cover
cut away towards the fielder at point, who is able to pounce on the ball, but can't prevent the single from being taken in the end as he fumbled the ball away on the first try
pulls this short ball, but hits it a bit too straight to the long on fielder
digs out this fuller length haring on the off stump

sends in a fierce yorker on middle and leg which the batsman was well late on, probably out of surprise, as he sent this down at a fair clip. Easily the fastest of all the bowlers on show today in just that one delivery
full outside of off as this is drilled towards point
induces the outside edge, but the batsman is able to edge this past the slips to find a boundary through third man
full delivery which strikes the batsman just above the left shoe as Chameera went up for the shout, but the angle suggested this was definitely going down leg
Coleman responds to the previous delivery with a wonderful straight drive to this pitched up deliver on and around middle
back of a length and cut away just behind of square as Malinga, who looked ungainly as he came round from third man, is unable to stop this from going over, despite putting in a dive
whips away a single onto the leg side to get off the strike
gets away this fuller one with a sliced drive to third man
length delivery which is bunted away on the off side by the Scottish captain
covers the line of this one angling in from outside off on a length
shortish length which is fended away on the off side
slaps away this back of a length to the man at sweeper cover
another one which is allowed to go through third man. They should look at putting in a fielder there as a number of strokes have fallen through that area
succeeds in getting an outside edge that lands just in front of Mahela to his right as he tried to get his hand on it. Ends up flying away to the third man rope
length outside of off which is worked over to the covers, before some sloppy fielding from both sides of the wicket allows them to get two more
looks to clatter this short of a length square off the wicket, but is late on it
on the back foot as this one is bunted away towards the cover region
dispatches this short delivery over midwicket to find the boundary
length delivery on and around off which is respected by the batsman
width given outside of off as he hit this aerially over to deep extra-cover
shortish length outside of off which is played away to the cover region
tries to ease away a run now through long on, but can't pinch the single
fuller length, on the pads, which Coleman clips away expertly through the vacant cow corner region to move to 49
and he gets to his fifty with a push to the off side. Receives generous applause from the Hobart crowd for his effort
able to get away a single to this short of a length outside of off, working this one away close to him on the leg side
is late on this attempted flick through the on side, but doesn't stop them from running the leg bye
nurdles away a single on the back foot to deep backward square
attacks this back of a length, but picks out the man at backward point
full and angling in on off as Mommsen drives hard, but picks out the mid-on fielder
in the slot as Preston is able to drill this one on the up through extra-cover
short delivery which Coleman tries in vain to ramp over to the third man region
chips this length delivery outside his off stump, but has to reach for it, with this one going over, but landing safely in the end in the deep
fuller delivery which is steered down towards mid-on
length delivery which is pushed away to the covers before he barreled down to the other end. There was a shy at the stumps at the striker's, but the dive from Coleman had him in
directs away this short delivery through midwicket
pitched up and driven down to mid-on to end the over
dropped Kusal makes a complete hash of this mis-timed slice over the covers from the batsman. Really was a straightforward chance, but just burst through in the end
not at all affected by the previous ball as he goes after this short, wide delivery angling away. Called wide by the umpire
Preston now earns a life as he flat-bats one over long off, with this one evading the fielders chasing from the ring
another lofted, mistimed pull which lands in no-mans land, this time around mid-on. Scotland getting some good fortune here so far
eases away a single through the covers to rotate the strike
pitched up and driven firmly by the batsman to the long on fielder
fends away this back of a length on the off side
given plenty of air as this one is driven away to the mid-off fielder
another flighted ball which this time is worked away to the backward point
darted in on the pads as this is defended back to him
advances down to drive this one past the bowler to long off
fails to get away a single through the covers as Dlishan fields the ball in the area
steers this one down to long off as there doesn't seem to be any urgency on the part of SL to attack for wickets. Also brings up the pair's 100-run stand
fires in a length outside of off which Preston is late on

steers away a single off the back foot through backward point. Preston gets to his fifty as well as a result. Has really been some serene batting from the two, apart from the odd risk which has not come off for Sri Lanka
like this one, as Coleman sends over a mistimed pull to midwicket, but there are no fielders in the vicinity
sends away this back of a length outside off with a powerful slap, finding the sweeper cover in a hurry
short of a length as Coleman fails to get this one away square off the wicket
comes down the track to try and send Chameera back over his head, but the ball ends up flying through to the keeper
drives this one away outside of off to the man at cover
comes down the track before easing this one away to long off
able to get away this reverse sweep to this delivery bowled on the full, but picks out the short third man
goes for the heave over midwicket, with this one reined in before the boundary
tossed up just outside off, and spinning away, as this is helped away to extra-cover
backs away before drilling this to the man in the deep at extra-cover to end the over
length delivery outside off which is run down to third man
slower delivery from Perera, but it was well outside the line. Called a wide by the umpire
length delivery around off, Mommsen leans forward, opens the face of the bat and pushes it to backward point
great shot from the Scottish captain. It was short and sat up nicely for Mommsen to swivel and pull behind square, with the ball rocketing to the fence
very poor ball from Perera. Another slower one and this one is even further away from the line
angling in on middle, Mommsen waits for it and clips it towards midwicket to get off strike
length delivery just outside off, Coleman was pushing at it from the crease, gets an outside edge that runs away down to third man

and finally, after what seems like ages, the stand is broken as Mommsen drives this fuller length delivery on the up straight to the short cover fielder, who is able to take the catch comfortably as he dove forward
steers away a single down to deep extra-cover to get off the strike
drives this one away to the covers, but is held by the close-in fielder
pierces through Dilshan's attempt at collecting this at short cover, with a full-blooded drive which races away to the extra-cover boundary
now flights a delivery on middle and leg which is swept away powerfully over the square-leg boundary for a six
defended with a slightly angled face onto the off side
works one away down to towards the deep on the off side
gets forward before finding the single in the gap at cover point
fuller one, outside of off, which is drilled to the man at mid-off
short of a length which is negotiated safely by Coleman off the back foot
steps over the off side to try and reach out to this slower, full delivery, but is still unable to get to it despite the extra effort
fails to get this away this length delivery outside off past point
finds the gap behind of square on the leg side as this long hop down the leg side is punished with an effective pull shot
drifting one down the leg side as this is helped away behind of square
flighted outside of off as this is drilled straight to the extra-cover fielder
steers this next one down to the fellow at long off
driven down to the fielder at long on, but can't get it past him
Prasanna has been poor today as he lobs up one which is slog-swept through cow corner for a six. Bowled this one flat so he could get under it effectively
slipping down the leg side as this is swept round the corner to bring drinks on the field
begins with a length delivery which the batsman plays just inside of the line of
short of a length and fended away behind of square by the batsman
looking to pick the space past long on, but hits it straighter than he would have liked to the fielder
gets far too early into this attempted short-arm pull as this slower ball almost clips the off stump
fails to get away this improvised scoop over fine leg, as he shimmied over a great deal to the off side to play this back-of-the-hand slower ball

Coleman has to go after looking for the heave over long on, ends up getting a toe-end to this slower ball which goes up straight over mid-on, with Perera settling under it nicely. Departs the oval, but has played a valuable knock all the same
deceives the batsman with this loopy, full length slower ball. Would have bowled him had this been on target
fires in a yorker which was sliding on the pads as Leask fails to get this away
low, full toss slower ball which is tickled away with the angle through fine leg
tries a quicker ball, albeit a full toss, which is fended away by the batsman safely
length delivery on and around middle which is defended away by the batsman
fires in a traditional yorker which is dug out safely in the end by Berrington
fuller delivery, angling in on middle and off, as Leask gets a slight inside-edge onto the pads
dabs down a run through third man to get off the strike
wide yorker which he is able to reach to, but ends up lasering this away through point, with cover point flying to his left to intervene
sends in a bouncer which Leask is late on as he had a flash

looks to send this shorter ball high over midwicket, but is unable to get to it. Looked like it might be called a wide, before Sangakkara, thinking the batsman may have got a bat on it, asked for a review. Doesn't appear to be any indication of bat on ball on first glance, but Snicko has something a bit more definitive, as there appears to be a flicker on the line when the ball passed through, hitting somewhere around the bottom edge of the bat. After some deliberation, the decision has come in, and he has been given out. Excellent review by Sangakkara, as he seemed to be the only one confident about this
greeted to the crease with a yorker down to mid-off, before some sloppy work by the fielder allowed him through to get the single to get off the mark
full delivery on and around off which is defended by the batsan
negotiates this Malinga special on and around off
defended away to the off side, but can't pinch a single
searching for the blockhole as he lets loose a low full toss which is struck away to the mid-on fielder
slower ball which is slogged over towards midwicket, but luckily falls away from the fielder
manages to get away this low, full toss through backward square, completing a brace in the process
forces the batsman on the back foot with this shortish length which he looked to pull through midwicket

extremely fortunate for Cross as he is surprised by the pace of this short of a length, hanging his bat as the ball went off the face to fly over Sangakkara towards the boundary, but is pulled back before the rope
follows the batsman, who was backing away to create room on the off side, with a yorker which finds its mark, as Cross dug it away on the on side

Cross' little Hobart adventure comes to a close as he looks to flat-bat this one over the bowler, with this flying just to the right and back of the keeper at third man, who is able to get his gloves around it as it swirled in the air
unleashes an above-waist full toss which is carted away through fine leg, but only just. Replays show this was more around the thigh, so a bit unlucky for him as he got penalised
works away this back of a length on the leg side
able to get away this fuller delivery on and around off with a scythe through long off which beats the chasing fielder from mid-off to the boundary
slips in a yorker right on the money which is dug away by the batsman to the off side
firing down the leg side now as somehow Sri Lanka get away with this potential wide. Probably had to do with Taylor following it by backing towards the delivery
now tests him with a slow, short bouncer which has Taylor throwing his hands through the shot far too early
another mistimed lofted stroke somehow evades a fielder as this length delivery is sent over long on, but away from any prying hands

completely miscues this back of a length as he hit this aerially over mid-on. Was another slower ball which caught the toe-end as Perera is given another opportunity at catching practice. Scotland eight down now as Sri Lanka look to deliver the final rites
able to pick up a single square off the wicket to retain the strike
Chameera sends in a fuller length which is clubbed away, although not well enough, to the fellow at mid-off, who almost fumbles it as it went through the hands before he could consolidate the catch
tries him out with a short ball outside of off which he is not tempted to engage with
searching for the blockhole as Evans does well to dig this one out on the off side
length delivery on middle and leg which is fended away on the leg side
runs away this short of a length outside of off to third man

back of a length delivery on the pads, Davey hops up in the crease and tucks it away towards midwicket. There was a slight hesitation as the batsmen went in for the single, but the batsman makes it in time at the non-striker's end as the fielder had a shy at the stumps
loopy full toss down leg as Davey moves slightly across but fails to tickle it fine
full and outside off as Davey leans forward and knocks it onto the off side
slower length delivery just outside off. Davey goes for the loft over cover, but doesn't get hold of it properly as this falls away in the deep
slower full toss that was dipping in on the leg stump. Davey backs away and just about gets his bat down in time to push it back towards the bowler
able to nurdle a single through midwicket now
slow full toss which just falls short of the fielder stationed wide of mid-on, as this one fell inside of the ring
and Sri Lanka wrap it up here in Hobart, courtesy of this edge off Chameera's bowling which flies comfortably to Lahiru at first slip, who is able to get low to his left to pluck it
